intro: Hieracium calodon subsp. ochrophyllum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
